intro: Byrsonima laxiflora var. montana, commonly known as mountain mallow, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
